name: Datswer
description: Datswer - help a brave hero escape to freedom from the dark dungeon full of traps, horrible enemies and various obstacles. The protagonist of this Android game is a statue that came to life after being hit by a few drops of mysterious magical liquid. You need to use your reflexes and logic to pave a safe way through dark dungeons.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or Later Processor: Intel® Core™ 2 Duo 2.4 GHz, AMD Athlon™ X2 2.8 GHz, or higher Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: ATI Radeon / NVIDIA GeForce / Intel DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 500 MB available space Sound Card: Windows Compatible Card

reviews.review_text: While the developer seems to be trying really hard to make the game better, as of update 2.5.1, the game still has terrible controls (like a phone game - click once to move, twice to run, click on the character and select again to crouch, jump forward or jump).   Cons:  - I could only play the game by moving the executable to the game's main folder. Otherwise, Steam would not even see the .exe file.  - Terrible controls with the mouse (a platformer without controller or keyboard support is a game-breaker for me)  - a horrible bug after dying that made my character get stuck above the checkpoint (I have uploaded a picture to Steam) - bad English (the Continue option means Reload Checkpoint, which does not make sense, just to give an example)  Pros  - nice graphics style - nice audio effects  I really want to play this game, and hope I can change my review in the future.
